CatDescriptText: Albert Hayes, college student, North Hills and Dorothy Craig, cook, McKees Rocks, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 26, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should intervene in the student sit-down demonstrations?"  Mr. Hayes' answer reads: "The Government is going to have to intervene in some way to settle the problems.  Things are pretty bad."  Mrs. Craig's answer reads: "The state should take care of its own issues."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Albert Hayes wearing light colored striped zippered jacket, standing in front of C.A. Michel store with Pittsburgh Paints sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Dorothy Craig wearing light colored coat and dark gloves with eyelet trim, standing in front of building next to C.A. Michel store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown
